overview_info.Subject:
Das Jewish Studies gehört zum Studienbereiche Oriental Studies der Fächergruppe Language and Cultural Studies.Weitere Informationen zur Fächergruppe Language and Cultural Studies.
                                                Jewish Studies

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: The aim of the course of study:As a humanities subject, Jewish Studies involves reflection on the basic cultural principles of society on a large as well as on a small scale. The task of a humanities scholar is mainly to understand, to explain and lastly also to mediate between groups, and to teach people and society.In its BA in Jewish Studies, the Hochschule für Jüdische Studien Heidelberg aims to teach skills in addition to the main subject at the Universität Heidelberg with particular emphasis on Jewish life, history and culture.Admission requirements:An admission requirement for academic study is a general higher education entrance qualification or a comparable qualification.Qualification and content:Jewish life is not restricted to religious rituals, but also encompasses all areas of life. Correspondingly, the Hochschule für Jüdische Studien offers several sub-areas, starting with the history of the Jewish people, to the Bible and Talmud, Philosophy, Literature and Linguistics right up to Jewish Art.Through this unique diversity of subjects, the Hochschule für Jüdische Studien can give a comprehensive image of Judaism in Germany, Europe and the world.The academic degree of Bachelor of Arts obtained upon completion of the course qualifies students for a postgraduate degree course with the degree of Master of Arts in Jewish Studies; it also allows, however, direct entry into a profession at Jewish museums, memorial sites, in academic institutions, print, online and radio media or other institutions which rely on the corresponding skills.

                                                Jewish Studies
overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Jewish Studies, Bible and Jewish Bible Interpretation, History of the Jewish people, Jewish Art, Jewish Intellectual History, Jewish Religious Studies, Talmud, Jewish Literatures

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: The Bachelor's degree course in Jewish Studies can be studied either in a major subject-minor subject model (75% - 25%) or in a major subject-major subject model (50% - 50%).Prospective students should be prepared to learn Hebrew at various language stages. They should moreover be interested in the diversity of Jewish religion and culture.

overview_info.Subject:
Das Jewish Studies gehört zum Studienbereiche Oriental Studies der Fächergruppe Language and Cultural Studies.Weitere Informationen zur Fächergruppe Language and Cultural Studies.
                                                Jewish Studies

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: Can be studied either in a major subject-minor subject model (75% - 25%) or in a major subject-major subject model (50% - 50%).The aim of the degree course:As a Humanities subject, Jewish Studies involves reflection on the basic cultural principles of society on a large as well as on a small scale. The task of a Humanities scholar is mainly to understand, to explain and also to mediate – between groups, between people and in society.In its BA in Jewish Studies, the Hochschule für Jüdische Studien Heidelberg aims to teach skills which enable students to take on future tasks with a sound knowledge of Jewish life, culture and history. The Hochschule für Jüdische Studien, with its eight chairs, provides the ideal conditions for this as a European skills centre.In addition, a subject is taken at the Universität Heidelberg with a weighting of 25%, such as Political Science, History or Islamic Studies.Admission requirements:An admission requirement for academic study is a general higher education entrance qualification or a comparable qualification.Qualification and content:Jewish life is not restricted to religious rituals, but also includes all areas of life. Correspondingly, the programme offered by the Hochschule für Jüdische Studien contains several sub-areas, starting with the history of the Jewish people, to the Bible and Talmud, Philosophy, Literature and Linguistics right up to Jewish Art. Through this unique diversity, the Hochschule für Jüdische Studien can give a comprehensive image of Judaism in Germany, Europe and the world.The academic degree of Bachelor of Arts obtained upon completion of the course qualifies students for a postgraduate degree course with the degree of Master of Arts in Jewish Studies.The BA course in Jewish Studies also allows direct entry into a profession at Jewish museums, memorial sites, in academic institutions, print, online and radio media or other institutions which rely on the corresponding skills.

overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Banking, Finance

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: Banking and finance is an important and dynamic field. Our Banking and Finance programme not only offers academic excellence but allows you to study in Europes financial hub and gain access to Germanys largest finance faculty. Surrounded by leading banks and top companies, you will undoubtedly have multiple opportunities to network and gain valuable experience. During your B.Sc. you will learn how to work in various relevant roles, how to make important decisions and excel in your communicative, numerical and analytical skills. You will learn all about financial markets, financial statements, financial planning and much more.Highlights Fully taught in English Endless opportunities by studying finance in Frankfurt, Europe's economic hub Study with students from all over the world Excellent career prospects by studying at a top Business School Enjoy one semester at one of our international partner universities Gain professional work experience through an internship abroad Live in the successful, vibrant and thriving city of Frankfurt

overview_info.Subject:
Das Jewish Studies gehört zum Studienbereiche Oriental Studies der Fächergruppe Language and Cultural Studies.Weitere Informationen zur Fächergruppe Language and Cultural Studies.
                                                Jewish Studies

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: The aim of the course of study:The Bachelor's degree course in Practical Jewish Studies 100% is composed of two equal parts: an academic part and a religion-based part. The academic part of the course corresponds to the BA course in Jewish Studies (50%). The remaining 50% is composed of religion-based modules about the traditional study of laws, prayer practices, Jewish education, for example. The two parts of the course are coordinated appropriately. Jewish Studies benefits from the intensive traditional study of sources; a modern religious concept benefits from the knowledge of modern scientific methods.For information on the creation of the BA course in Practical Jewish Studies, which emerged from the BA course in Community Work and is now being offered in a revised form for the winter semester 2011, please read the report of the Dean of Studies, Prof. Dr. Daniel Krochmalnik here.Admission requirements:An admission requirement for academic study is a general higher education entrance qualification or a comparable qualification.Qualification and content:Through the Bachelor's degree course, a solid basis for postgraduate Religious Studies should be created, which can be completed at cooperating rabbinical institutions.In addition, the Bachelor's degree forms the prerequisite for the continuation of an academic degree after obtaining the rabbinic ordination or other religious diplomas (MA, doctorate).

Digital teaching and learning units: E-Learning, Blended Learning, Onlinetutorien und virtuelle Seminarräume
Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: A Bachelor's degree in Big Data Management is the ideal prerequisite for a career in the rapidly changing world of work. Professional Big Data management is key for keeping up with the rapid pace of digitisation. Proven experts take care of data mining and quantitative analysis, data storytelling and communication, and ensure optimal data visualisation in the management cockpit. Decide on this indispensable area in your continuing education project and open up fields of activity at the sources of modern business and industry 4.0 from social media marketing to innovation management for digital business models. If you like to work in an interdisciplinary manner, this course is just right for you: Here, technology knowledge meets corporate management. Combine the versatile field of data analysis with management tasks and become a distance learning academically trainer leader in Big Data.

overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Food Analytics, Pharma Analytics

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: The world we live in is fraught with challenges: understanding climate change, identifying and treating major illnesses in a timely manner, solving violent crime, developing modern medicines to deal with new diseases, keeping sport free from doping and reducing drug trafficking. All of this would not even be imaginable without the contribution of modern bioanalytics. Come to Sigmaringen and learn about Bioanalytics (B.Sc.) Do your part to make the world a little bit better!Combined with the focus on laboratory automation, the Bioanalytics degree program is something unique in Germany and addresses the industry's high demand for specialists who have expertise in biology, physics and chemistry and a deep understanding of automated, future-oriented laboratory solutions. This opens up new, attractive and diverse professions in the field of bioanalytics.
